questions.answer_description:
Box 1: 2 -
File1.docx (Created by User1) and File2.docx (public)

Box 2: 2 -
File2.docx (public) and File3.docx (default),

Box 3: 3 -
File2 (public) + File3 (Default, user1 creates File3 then User3 signs in) + File4 (desktop, user3)
questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have a computer named Computer1 that runs Windows 10.
Computer1 has the users shown in the following table.
//IMG//

User1 signs in to Computer1, creates the following files, and then signs out:
✑ File1.docx in C:\Users\User1\Desktop
✑ File2.docx in C:\Users\Public\Public Desktop
✑ File3.docx in C:\Users\Default\ Desktop
User3 then signs in to Computer1 and creates a file named File4.docx in C:\Users\User3\Desktop.
User2 has never signed in to Computer1.
How many DOCX files will appear on the desktop of each user the next time each user signs in? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
User1: File1.docx and File2.docx = 2 files (file3.docx is only for new users)
User2: File2.docx and File3.docx = 2 files (File3.docx because he has never been logged on before)
User3: Fil12.docx and File3.docx = 2 files. (User3 is a guest user, and there fore he will get a new profile every time he logs on. Therefore he will get File3.docx and File4 was deleted (with the profile) when he logged off after creating the file)

comments.content: User2 Only gets only 2 files if its also member of the Users group. The table in the questions says "user2 is member of the Replicator group". so User2 won't be able to log in. When User2 is also member of the users group, it gets 2 files. i just tested.

FINAL ANSWER TESTED IN A WINDOWS 10 PRO 21H2 build, replicating the exact same conditions step-by-step:
User1 - 2 - File1 and File2
User2 - 2 - File2 and File3
User3 - 2 - File2 and File4
It doesn't matter if User2 is a Replicator member, it works anyway.
It doesn't matter if User3 is a Guest MEMBER (not the deprecated guest user), he does NOT load a new profile every time from the Default profile and he KEEPS the files that he created before Sign Out - Sign In.
The question is "How many DOCX files will APPEAR on the desktop of each user the next time each user signs in". So, obviously, User1 will NOT see File3 because he will NOT load the Default profile every time. The answer provided couldn't be more wrong.
Tested in lab for you. You're welcome.

User2 is in the Replicator group. A group for computers, not users. Here is the link explaining this:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/it-pro/windows-server-2008-r2-and-2008/cc771990(v=ws.10)
And User3 is not the "guest" user because Windows 10 deprecated this, he is just member of the guest group, meaning less privileges.
So this question is very, very strange.
User3 won't see File4, because Guest setttings and files are not saved. I just tested it i lab.
Wrong, User3 KEEPS the files that he created before. Tested in a Win10 Pro 21H2.

I confirm this. I checked this on my Win 10 v1909 vm and files are present as per Mendel's comment:
- User 1: File1 and File2
- User 2: File 2 and File3
- User 3: File 2, File 3 and File 4
But he is not the "guest" user because Windows 10 deprecated this, he is just member of the guest group, meaning less privileges.
Every time a guest user logs in, they will be treated as new.
User 3 is an existing user, so it won't get file 3.
User 3 is a guest and will not get File4

I want to say special thanks to you, I passed my MD-100 and now preparing MD-101.
Your comments are always valuable and I trust what you say. Thank you so much
Pinky:)
not true, it keeps all the 3 files.

discussion.content:
Isn't it User1: 2, User 2: 2 and User3: 3?

User 1: File1 and File2
User 2: File 2 and File3
User 3: File 2, File 3 and File 4

File 2 on Public desktop appears on all existing and new users
File 3 on Default desktop only appears on new users

Based on the information laid out in the question, the answer is 2,0,2. User2 is not stated to be a member of a group that can login. It is also stated that User2 has never logged in. If it's wrong then its MS fault for wording it in this way. We answer questions based on the information given to us. We can't be expected to make baseless assumptions. Answer is 2,0,2.
This question was on the MD-100 exam I took a few days ago.

If I understand correctly, the answer to User3 depends if User3 signed in for the first time or not, right?

If we assumed User3 signed in for the first time after the files are created, he'll get File2 and 3, then create File4. Since no files will be lost on logout, User3 will have 3 files on its desktop.

But if we assume User3 DID sign in previously, at any moment, then they would only get File2 on sign-in, and create File4, totalling 2 files when they sign in again.

Honestly, this question is kinda dubious. It doesnt specify if User3 has signed in before or not, and knowing Microsoft, it could go both ways

Final Answer - 2, 0, 2
The Replicator Group, cannot logon locally, it has no default user rights, so User2 has 0 files
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/it-pro/windows-server-2008-r2-and-2008/cc771990(v=ws.10)

2 2 2
just tested in the lab

This is a sneaky one, you get the contents of the default desktop when a new desktop is created - i.e. when a new user signs in.

Because User 1 already exists he doesn't get to see the file in the default desktop.

Correct me if i'm wrong, but a normal user which is a member of the Guests group, is actually not a normal guest user. A normal guest user would log in using "Guest" and then the profile will be new every time he logs in. But User3 which is a part of the Guests group would still have the file which he created on the desktop when he logs back in, then i would say that the given answer is correct.

2 files - User 1 File 2 on public desktop and file 1 on desktop
2 files - User 2 file 2 on public desktop and file 3 on default desktop
3 files - User 3 file 2 on public desktop, file 3 on default desktop, and file4 on desktop

It specifies "user 3 then signs in" implying they sign in after User 1 created the file on the default desktop so they would get it.

Description of Guests group on Windows 10 Pro 21H2 machine
"Guests have the same access as members of the Users group by default, except for the Guest account which is further restricted"
3-2-2 should be correct

Forget the theory, I just tested this out. 
User 1 gets 2 files (1 and 2)
User 2 CANT even log in, he's a member of the replicator group only (doesn't mention Users... ) so he gets 0 files. 
User 3 gets 3 files - W10 doesnt do the TEMP thing. This is a user named User3, who is a member of guests (and not the Guest).

Final answer as tested... 2, 0, 3
Rules. Default is a 1 time creation on first login. Guest users get a temporary profile, recreated every time they log in. Default wont apply for already created profiles.
Beginning to wonder if these answers are pulled out of a hat.

2, 2, 2 if user3 has already signed in before user1 created the files.

2, 2, 3 if user3 signs in for the first time after user1 created the files.

discussion.content:
User1: File1.docx (Created by User1) and File2.docx (public)
User2: File2.docx (public) and File3.docx (default) (Question specifically indicates User2 has never signed in before.)
User3: File2.docx (public) and File4.docx (Created by User3) 
(Question did not indicate User3 has never signed in before so he won't get File3.docx, Also need to note that User3 is in Guests group, it is not a guest account, therefore profile won't be re-created so File4.docx remains. The difference between Guests and Users Group is Guests Group is more restrictive)
Content from public folder does not get copied to the logged in user, they only have access to that folder. 1, 1, 2

comments.content: Typo: User3 = 3files

discussion.content:
User1: File2 (public) + File1 (desktop, user1) = 2 files
User2: File2 (public) + File3 (Default,never signed in) = 2 files
User3: File2 (public) + File3 (Default, user1 creates File3 then User3 signs in) + File4 (desktop, user3) = 2 files
Deleting of Guest profiles depents on Windows 10 build version. Newer builds don't remove guest profiles.

Note the Question - "How many DOCX files will appear on the desktop of each user THE NEXT TIME each user signs in?"

User1 = 2 (C:\Users\Default\ Desktop will only be referenced upon first creating of a profile). Thus only File1.docx in C:\Users\User1\Desktop & File2.docx in C:\Users\Public\Public Desktop.

User2 = 2 Has never signed in to Computer1. First login will reference C:\Users\Public\Public Desktop & C:\Users\Default\Desktop thus having File2.docx & File3.docx

User3 = 2 Although User3 is part of the Guest group (meaning that the entire profile will be deleted upon logoff). When logging back in, C:\Users\Public\Public Desktop & C:\Users\Default\Desktop will be referenced again, thus having File2.docx & File3.docx

https://ss64.com/nt/syntax-security_groups.html
User 3 signs in after User 1 added the files, thus Used 3 will have File 2, File 3 and File 4 = 3
2,2,2 tested, on the desktop is the question!
2 / 2 / 2 for me

comments.content: Lol, the public folder has a desktop folder!

discussion.content:
Question asks "How many DOCX files will appear on the desktop of each user"
"DESKTOP OF EACH USER" not "PUBLIC FOLDER"

tested , tested and tested again ..... 2,2,2 be carrefull if you made the test, consider user 3 has already log on to the computers , even if answer will be 2,2,3. but in the question, user3 not mentioned as "first login" as user2.

Well, has anyone noticed the space character in front of the folder name for File3.docx? You cannot create that directory in Explorer, but for sure in a command shell: md " Desktop" ... (I tested that) ...

With that in mind my answer would be:
User1: 2, because he sees the files from his own desktop and the public desktop.
User2: 1, because he sees the file from the public desktop (File3 is copied as part of the profile creation process, but since it is not the "real" desktop folder the file will not appear on the desktop).
User3: 1, because after logout his profile is removed as he is a member of the guest group (I tested that on current OS, older versions might behave differently), which leads to the same result as with User2.

Now, one could argue the space character is a typo ... from my experience with MS test that very seldom happens in the live tests - so watch out!!
(BTW: Without the space my answer would be 2-2-2)
https://ss64.com/nt/syntax-security_groups.html

I tested this on a windows 10 v1909 VM and I got 
User1 - 2
User2 - 2
User3 - 3

User3 signed in only after user1 created the files including the one in the default folder and signed out. Since the file is already in the default folder when user3 signed in, he got the file on the desktop.

2,0,2
The Default User profile is a template profile for all created users. Whenever you create a new user profile, the profile is built based on the Default User profile.
It is not used for subsequent logins.
Files placed in public desktop paths are only visible to existing users (1,2,3)
User 1 (Own user profile plus Public Desktop profile) - 2
User 2 is a replicator and their user account will not show up on the logon screen - 0
User 3 (Own profile plus Public Desktop profile. Existing user so will not get the default profile) -2
Microsoft stopped reliably deleting profiles on logout for members of the Guests group with the release of Windows 7

discussion.content: if you put file in default, it doesn't matter if your profile does already exist or not. it's always showing for all user profile. it's from my experience..

The Default User profile is a template profile for all created users. Whenever you create a new user profile, the profile is built based on the Default User profile.

The Public Folder is for sharing files with all other users that in the system, or on network. All local users can access this profile, but cannot access your private user profile.
Only other users can retrieve a document save by a guest user after he log off
User 1 - File1.docx / File2.docx / File3.docx
User 2 - File2.docx
User 3 - File2.docx

Admin Login1: File1=private, File2=public, File3=default
Admin Login2: File1=YES, File2=YES, File3=NO ---> total 2 (1+2)

User3 Login1: File4=private
User3 Login2: File4=YES, File2=YES, File3=NO ---> total 2 (4+2)

User2 Login0: File2=YES, File3=YES (new profile) ---> total 2 (2+3)

Please note that there is no Guest user involved but only a guest"S" group member.
Guest"s" have the same access as members of the Users group by default, except for the Guest ! account which is further restricted. (see the local groups in W10).

discussion.content:
My answer is 
User 1:2
User2: 2
User3: 3

Files in C:\Users\Default\Desktop are only copied to new users (meaning they have not logged on to the PC before).
Files on the desktop for members of the Guests group are retained after logoff. I checked it. My test user is only a member of the Guests group on a stand alone W10 1809 VM. After logging on, creating a file and logging off and than back on again the file is still there.
Answer is:
User1: 2 files (1 file on personal desktop and 1 file on public desktop)
User2: 2 files (1 file on personal desktop, copied from C:\Users\Default\Desktop and 1 file on public desktop)
User3: 3 files (2 files on personal desktop, 1 copied from C:\Users\Default\Desktop because User3 logs on after User1 created the file in C:\Users\Default\Desktop and 1 file the user created. 1 file on public desktop.

This asumes however that user3 has never logged on to the computer before User1 created the file in C:\Users\Default\Desktop. This is not clearly stated. But is most likely.
2-2-2 For all them users

The question is, if User1 and User 3 never logged in before file creation, creating files in question order will result
User1 > 2
User2 > 2
User3 > 3

If they were logged in before file creation (created profiles), result would be

User1 > 2
User2 > 2
User3 > 2

comments.content: I agree. Dont get tricked by replicator security group, it is there to throw you off. Any user that logs onto a windows machine will get read access to public desktop via the interactive security group token.
User 3 is a guest though, the profile will not be retained when they log off.

No, User3 is not a guest user, but user in Guests group. That's different. Guest's account profile will not be retained, but user's profile who is in Guests group will. 
So the answer should be 

User1 : 2
User2 : 2
User3 : 3

discussion.content: The answer is correct as the replicator has no rights it will receive the default profile and the default profile as one file created by the administrator.

User1: 2 (will be on the Desktop)
User2: 0 (Replicator group users have no user rights)
User3: 2 (files created by Guest group users are removed at sign-out)

User1:2 (file1 and file2)
User2:1 (file3)

Note that files placed directly in user desktop paths are visible by the user
Also note that files places in Default user desktop paths are only visible to new users (never signed in. Eg user 2)
And files placed in public desktop paths are only visible to existing users (user1 and user3)

User1: File1 and File2
